Office.definition: Establishes broadband office; defines authority or responsibility of broadband office

Task force.definition: Establishes a broadband task force or advisory committee; defines authority or responsibility of the task force or advisory committee

Mapping.definition: Defines mapping or data collection requirements for broadband providers

Plan.definition: Defines requirements for a broadband plan or strategy.  Includes requirements for local or regional plans.

Promotional.definition: Creates a promotional program (e.g. Broadband Ready Community)

Goal.definition: Defines a goal for statewide broadband service provision

Agency.definition: Tasks a specific state office or agency with overseeing broadband activity, either for state operations or generally

Fund.definition: Establishes a fund for the purpose of expanding broadband infrastructure

Fund - Other.definition: Establishes a fund for another purpose that can be used to support expansion of broadband infrastructure

State USF.definition: Addresses use of state universal service funds or state high cost support mechanisms to support broadband infrastructure or access.

Tax incentives.definition: Establishes a tax incentive for broadband infrastructure, equipment, or service provision

Financing - Other.definition: Establishes another type of funding or financing mechanism (including authorizing political subdivision to fund or finance broadband)

As defined by FCC or U.S. Code.definition: Defines broadband or an equivalent term (e.g., broadband network, high speed internet) - definition as defined by the FCC or as in US Code

Speed of 1.5 Mbps or less.definition: Defines broadband or an equivalent term (e.g., broadband network, high speed internet) - definition at speeds of less than 1.5 Mbps

Speed of 10 Mbps / 1 Mbps.definition: Defines broadband or an equivalent term (e.g., broadband network, high speed internet) - definition at 10 Mbps / 1 Mbps

Speed of 25 Mbps / 3 Mbps.definition: Defines broadband or an equivalent term (e.g., broadband network, high speed internet) - definition at 25 Mbps / 3 Mbps

Defined by technology, not speed.definition: Defines broadband or an equivalent term (e.g., broadband network, high speed internet) - defined as technology that provides high-speed access to the internet (no speed or FCC specification)

Municipal broadband.definition: Addresses provision of broadband by political subdivisions

Cooperatives.definition: Addresses provision of broadband by electric or telephone cooperatives (also called electric or telephone corporations in some states)

Regulatory authority.definition: Addresses jurisdiction of the Public Utilities Commission or equivalent agency to address broadband infrastructure or internet access services

Service provision (SP) - Other.definition: Addresses other elements of service provision not specified above, such as access for multiple tenant environment or multiple dwelling unit buildings

Pole attachments.definition: Addresses requirements for pole owners or pole attachers related to broadband service provision.

Permitting.definition: Addresses permitting for broadband infrastructure, wireless facilities, or small cell facilities either by state agencies or political subdivisions

Dig Once.definition: Addresses rights-of-way access for broadband infrastructure, wireless facilities, or small cell facilities either by state agencies or political subdivisions - Dig Once policies

Railroad.definition: Addresses rights-of-way access for broadband infrastructure, wireless facilities, or small cell facilities either by state agencies or political subdivisions - access to rail road rights of way

ROW - Other.definition: Addresses rights-of-way access for broadband infrastructure, wireless facilities, or small cell facilities either by state agencies or political subdivisions.  Policies other than Dig Once or railroad ROW.

Wireless facilities.definition: Address wireless facilities (other than permitting or rights-or-way access)

Small cell facilities.definition: Addresses small cell facilities (other than permitting or rights-of-way access)

Open access.definition: Defines requirements for open access (both generally and for publicly-owned networks)

IA - Other.definition: Addresses other elements of infrastructure access not specified above, such as microtrenching.

Legislative intent.definition: Defines legislative intent or purpose related to broadband provisions in statute

Other.definition: Related to broadband, but not fitting any of the above categories
